Literature Review: Embodied communication in human-robot interaction (HRI) has been a rapidly evolving field, with a growing emphasis on developing algorithms that support fluent and expressive use of physical interaction between humans and robots. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of the art in pHRI, highlighting the progression from algorithms based on physical analogies to computational methods that take advantage of multimodal communication channels. We will discuss the existing algorithmic approaches that regulate and interpret pHRI, and argue that emergent embodied dialogue is one of the next frontiers of pHRI.
